description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides assistance to the World Food Programme's (WFPs) Protracted Relief and Recovery Operations (PRRO) in Burma to improve the food security, nutrition status and livelihoods of vulnerable populations where approximately 5 million people are food-insecure. Those living in Northern Rakhine, Chin, Kachin, Northern Shan and Eastern Shan states and Magway Division are the most vulnerable. The WFP are addressing this through the current PRRO. The overall objective is to respond to shocks and enhance vulnerable households' resilience by supporting 4 key areas: providing food assistance to meet immediate needs; supporting and re-establishing the livelihoods of populations affected by shocks; increasing levels of education and improving nutrition status of targeted women, girls and boys; and increasing food purchases from small farmers and improving their market opportunities while building the capacity of development partners to address food insecurity.
